item.title: Huge, dangerous pothole, 25th February

item.title: Numerous potholes on Brecknock road as you approach Nisa from Tufnell park, 25th February
item.description:
Potholes the size of craters all over Brecknock road particularly on the approach to Nisa and the shops travelling from Tufnell park to Camden road. They are so deep, you are required to stop and drive around them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Brecknock Road, Archway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continual fly tipping, 25th February
item.description:
Fly tipping multiple times a week in the exact same spot. Household waste/black bin bags.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ellenborough Road, North Cray, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipped furniture on pavement, 25th February
item.description:
Furniture fly tipped on pavement outside 10 Trewsbury Road. Blocking access for pedestrians, wheelchairs etc. Been there 3 days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Trewsbury Road, Perry Vale, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trampoline fly tipped on pavement, 25th February
item.description:
I have come home on Wednesday 25 February and noticed that someone has fly tipped a trampoline on the pavement by 35 Fleming way. It is right by a fence which also could be a fire hazard. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fleming Way, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More dog poo, 25th February
item.description:
Continued issue with dog being walked Up this street and leaving the poo
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Keston Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree Needs Pruning, 25th February
item.description:
The tree is the biggest in the street and hasn't been pruned in the 12 years we have been here. it is pushing up the pavement significantly as it has not been pruned. it is constantly filling our gutters with leaves, that we have to pay for to get removed. It has long branches that reach over to the property and when the win blows they break off and cause damage to the house and cars around the property, the tree down the road has been pollarded and this should get the same treatment to inhibit the growth, reduce the branch length and reduce leaf clutter on our property and the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairfield Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous fencing- accident waiting to happen, 25th February
item.description:
There is a large amount of wire linked fencing damaged along this public footpath. A child or dog will be injured on the fencing as its falling onto the pathway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxford Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown bushes obstructing path, 25th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crowden Way, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipping outside my property, 25th February
item.description:
People have dumped a wardrobe, fridge and chair and I am concerned that more will be added. I like to make sure the area outside my property is kept clean so myself and other tenants at 75 Alvington crescent are concerned. This pile started last weekend

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland High Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Enlarging pothole and road debris opposite Cascades NW3 7AJ, 25th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finchley Road, Golders Green, Greater London

item.title: Every week abandoned shopping trolleys meet!, 25th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kangley Bridge Road, New Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Outside number 15 Mill Lane, 25th February
item.description:
Some lower branches of the street tree are overhanging the pavement and the entrance to the building. The branches are also partially obstructing the view of the pedestrian light at the nearby zebra crossing. The tree is close to the building, and in the past there were minor root issues with plumbing that have now been resolved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Kilburn, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
